I think it depends on the person. I texted an old friend I hadn‚Äôt spoken to in years happy birthday once because I remembered and wanted to check in and we had a nice little chat. It wasn‚Äôt long, he doesn‚Äôt text me and I don‚Äôt text him, but when we were in high school we spoke a lot on the bus. He was really cool and it was just nice to speak again for a minute. Also, conversations work both ways, and that‚Äôs why I think it‚Äôs really important that it‚Äôs per person. I almost never text anyone unless they initiate but I still have snap streaks, not cause I care I actually hate them but it makes my friends happy.

Idk it was really poorly handled and stuff so the whole group was involved and I was told everyone told him to stop talking to me and he still did it anyways. 

Normally I think yes you should talk it out with people but this wasn‚Äôt a situation I felt like talking to him in and definitely think not saying anything definitely says something. 

Also I am male

I cut off someone and I feel kinda bad about but they were being really creepy towards me. They told me they had a crush on me for a while and I told them I was flattered but no. They couldn‚Äôt really take any hints and I know what it‚Äôs like to be in that situation so I didn‚Äôt want to say anything, problem is he told me when we were alone in my car after I drove him home from a gathering that night. I really didn‚Äôt want to be rude so I tried to comfort him but like I said he couldn‚Äôt take any hints and we were just sitting in the car very awkwardly as he apologized and said he felt stupid for about three hours, from 11 PM to 2 in the morning. I really had to pee so I finally said ‚ÄúHey I‚Äôve had to Lee for the last three hours...‚Äù and he left the car finally after apologizing more. 

Then he continues to just be very creepy, harassing my character in our D&D campaign and buying me gifts and insisting I take them despite declining. I made an effort to stop talking to him but he kept acting like everything was normal which it was not. 

There were several times my friends tried to get me to talk to him and once (possibly twice but I like to believe my friend wouldn‚Äôt do it twice) where one of them even tricked me into meeting up with him, to try and be our mediator. I explained again to the friend that I had no intention of speaking with him anymore and eventually left without meeting him. 

I eventually ceased all contact with him and it essentially ruined the friend group; D&D was extremely awkward being across the table from someone I didn‚Äôt want to see anymore and like I said he couldn‚Äôt take a hint very well at all so he would keep talking to me even though I made efforts to ignore him. This all came to a head when I (albeit abruptly) announced I would stop going to D&D. Our dungeon master was furious and it led to much more fighting. 

I guess what I‚Äôm trying to say is that as much as it‚Äôs hard for someone else to take, it can be hard for someone to give an explanation, and I think it all comes down to how the situation is handled and the people involved. I didn‚Äôt want to stop being friends, but his actions were just making me incredibly uncomfortable.
It‚Äôs petty... it‚Äôs rude... part of me feels like I should handle it differently... but damn, does that feel so good

So they ask me like, ‚ÄúHey I‚Äôm looking for a type of stuffed animal...‚Äù and I‚Äôm like yeah and I‚Äôm looking for any excuse to finally shoot myself maybe we can help each other out. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs blue, and it‚Äôs for kids.‚Äù Wow really narrows it down. ‚ÄúI saw it, you had it there earlier.‚Äù Oh yeah we did but I actually just sold all of our blue things for kids try tomorrow sleazeball. I ask Do you know what it is? Can you give me a name? ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt but you just had some there earlier I saw them on a shelf. I don‚Äôt really know what it‚Äôs called.‚Äù I just take a walk around toys a couple times and scope out the remaining push in the back room and tell them we don‚Äôt have any but maybe they could look it up. They didn‚Äôt want to so I apologized and ended the conversation.

The most important thing for all of them is to keep your head up and don‚Äôt get discouraged; the second you lose your cool most fighters and ARMS combos can combo you but that‚Äôs true of most fighting games, just remember to stand your ground and have fun :)

I always get really annoyed at Springtron spammers who just shockwave grab shockwave grab shockwave grab. The secret there is playing at a medium to close distance; safe enough to break grabs and safe enough to punish shockwave abuse. When fighting Springtrons I will always bring a faster Arm; anything left out too long is gonna get punished but that doesn‚Äôt mean you shouldn‚Äôt use slower ones, just send out the second Arm only if you‚Äôre sure the first will hit as it will cancel his charge. 

Ninjara is sort of similar in that you need to get those quick hits in. It‚Äôs better to try and observe the opponents play style  rather than observe just the moves coming at you, because a bad Ninjara will never stop spamming dash teleport and then it only comes down to punish timing on your part. It can be frustrating but just keep pushing and try and notice patterns.

I main Lola Pop and maybe it‚Äôs just cause I haven‚Äôt played in a while but I feel like I would have trouble with close range opponents. Her ability to shield in the air and quick fall and turn really fast could leave bad situations, but if you can get a grab in and just keep comboing the pressure would get to me.

I love Victis, and I‚Äôm so happy they came back. I‚Äôm okay with the final map being Victis. I‚Äôm okay with the final map being a remaster of Call of the Dead. I‚Äôm okay with the way it ended, because that‚Äôs kinda how it had to. But EVEN THEN, why was there no justice for Victis? I know they‚Äôre ‚ÄúVictims,‚Äù but it couldn‚Äôt have been too hard to have those four say their final wishes too somehow. If Pablo could teleport couldn‚Äôt they have? And then everything else I was able to bear through just kinda resurfaces and like... ugh. I don‚Äôt even have gameplay to fall back on because while I do like Tag Der Toten every time I play it now I can‚Äôt help but think of what a remastered COTD could‚Äôve played like with the old system. Everything is so good except for the annoying new perk system and terrible elixirs that are either way too overpowered or entirely pointless. I love hearing Russman, Marlton, Misty and Stu again but I can‚Äôt help but imagine why they don‚Äôt question the perk change? What is an elixir to them? Why don‚Äôt they question the special weapons? I know there‚Äôs a lot of unanswered Zombies questions but it just makes me sad now.

Stories about being a dumb kid are always so fun to look back on. I know it‚Äôs not EarthBound related but there‚Äôs a part in Super Paper Mario where the player is indebted and needs to pay off the debt with basically slave labor; hitting a block to produce one ‚Äúwatt‚Äù per hit or running on a wheel to do it a little bit faster. You can do this for a while but there‚Äôs a secret area you‚Äôre supposed to get hints about by giving up some watts and once you find it you sneak around and steal from the person you‚Äôre in debt to, and then pay off the debt with their own money. Child me never found the secret, and I grinded about like 50% of the debt for the entire week I rented the game. I think the debt was something around 1 million watts or something so I really got up there.

This is why I‚Äôm really disappointed in the Ratchet and Clank remake. Gameplay was okay I guess and visuals were wonderful, but Ratchet used to be kind of an asshole who got fed up with Clank‚Äôs robotic understanding of the world and seemingly programmed goody two shoes outlook. It made for fun interactions and gave the player multiple reasons to go to every planet. Pokitaru! There‚Äôs people to save there (if I remember correctly) which is the right thing to do, but Ratchet also mentions that he‚Äôs willing to go because it‚Äôs a fun place to be, and the player could discover something fun to do there. The remake makes them ‚Äúthe smart hero‚Äù and ‚Äúthe tough hero‚Äù and that‚Äôs boring imo.
I guess I think I maybe partially agree? I want a future where we get these people help instead of hate them, I want them to see why they are wrong and why racism is bad.

At the same time though it does seem kinda close minded. Media is made for everyone to enjoy so if someone wants to know what something is from it shouldn‚Äôt have to be some ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a secret!‚Äù kinda deal.

Wait, Thieves in Time is on Vita!?

Years ago, my friend let me borrow the Sly trilogy remade. I loved them and got the platinum on all three, even hundred percented the mini game trophies. 

After that, he let me borrow TiT (now that I look at the acronym that‚Äôs hilarious) and I loved that one as well. I played through it normally and then started trophy clean up, like I normally do. In the end I only needed to get the last few masks, use a secret weapon, and look at every map, but my friend needed it back before I could finish that. 

We kinda drifted apart after that. It‚Äôs been so long. I got more into the PlayStation brand because I love it and late last year in October for my birthday my friend gave me his old Vita. I‚Äôve been loving P4G and Um Jammer Lammy.

I gotta find a copy! Finally get that platinum! Can anyone CONFIRM that the trophies will carry over? I know sometimes if it‚Äôs a remake or rerelease it counts as different trophies.
